result.execSummary:
The defendant Destyn Michael Montaque was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of extended supervision.  Court ordered monies taken by the Department of Correction from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT to any other sentence now serving, with credit for FOUR HUNDRED NINE (409) days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant required to get, at minimun, an Associate Degree.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms or any body armor. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Destyn Michael Montaque in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Destyn Michael Montaque in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  AS TO COUNT #1:  The Court imposed the following sentence:  The Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be FIFTY-FOUR (54) months CONCURRENT to any other sentence now serving.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for EIGHTEEN (18) months with credit for FOUR HUNDRED NINE (409) days time served.  Defendant shall serve THIRTY-SIX (36) months on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program;
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court advised the defendant of the determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form CR-234.  Copy provided to defendant. 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms or any body armour. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
 - Defendant required to get, at minimun, an Associate Degree;
 - Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of extended supervision.  Court ordered monies taken by the Department of Correction from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Destyn Michael Montaque in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Destyn Michael Montaque in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  As to plea:  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court ordered the repeater portion be stricken.

AS TO COUNT #2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Matter set for sentencing on March 29, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
ORDER TO PRODUCE    RECEIVED AND FILED
